April 2025 County of Marin EMS ATG 4
ALS to BLS TRANSFER OF CARE
Indication
A patient identified via a 911 response that has been evaluated by a system paramedic and
deemed appropriate for BLS transport to the appropriate facility.
Does the patient have any of the
following complaints?
• Chest pain
• Shortness of breath
• ALOC from baseline
• Seizure
• Syncope
• Stroke symptoms
• Abdominal Pain
• Overdose symptoms
• Traumatiic injury to head or any trauma
No requiring Trauma Notification Yes
• Other concerning symptoms requiring
ALS
Is patient clinically stable?
• GCS 15 or at their normal
baseline
• No evidence of ALOC
No
• SBP >90mmHg and
ALS TRANSPORT
<190mmHg
• DBP <110mmHg
• HR >50 and <120
• RR >10 and <24
• SpO2 > 93%, >87% for COPD
• Pediatric vital signs are age-
appropriate normal range
Yes SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
Facility physicians may request a specific level of
care for transport (BLS, ALS, or CCT) based on
scope of care required. Documentation of a patient
BLS TRANSPORT
evaluation including vital signs, along with a
completed RAS form are required if ALS departs
scene prior to BLS arrival.
